Supports START/READ/KILL, regex filters, summary RPC with tail lines, alias resolution, 10-process cap
Background process manager UI now offers status filters, sort modes, inline t/p/k actions, and bookmark/description rows for clarity
Background shell events raise low-noise toasts and flash the mini-widget indicator so Cmd+B/Ctrl+B flows stay discoverable
Documented the background shell workflow: run_in_background directives, Ctrl+R/Ctrl+B shortcuts, RPCs, limits
README now advertises the background process manager and keyboard shortcuts so users discover the feature
Added BackgroundShellPollEvent and EventMsg variant so poll responses stream structured logs to the TUI
BackgroundProcessStore now tracks rolling log buffers, poll updates, and purge controls for a readable detail panel
Status footer now shows a cyan 'background tasks' pill so the BG indicator matches the requested mockups

ChatWidget tracks if a background hint was shown and surfaces a one-time toast reminding about Ctrl+B after the first ShellPromoted event
KillBackgroundShell now emits a '(Kill shell <name>)' note so background events distinguish manual termination and carry the user-friendly label
Shell event rendering detects kill descriptors, renders them as Kill(<command/bookmark>), and shows friendly details instead of duplicated Shell Failed entries
